rules.title: Magic Town Rules:
rules.rule1: Friends with fewer than 2 neighbors get lonely and leave
rules.rule2: Friends with 2-3 neighbors are happy and stay
rules.rule3: Friends with more than 3 neighbors feel crowded and leave
rules.rule4: Empty homes with exactly 3 neighbors attract new families

timeExplanation.title: Time in Magic Town
timeExplanation.intro: Each time step is like magic! When you press "Start Adventure", time moves forward one step at a time. Each step:
timeExplanation.step1: All friends decide if they want to stay or leave
timeExplanation.step2: New families might move into empty homes
timeExplanation.step3: The town changes all at once!
timeExplanation.counter: The "Time" counter shows how many magical changes have happened in your town!

mathExplanation.title: The Math Behind Mini Life Explorers
mathExplanation.intro1: Conway's Game of Life is like a special math puzzle! It was created by a mathematician named John Conway in 1970.
mathExplanation.intro2: The magic town works on a grid where each home follows simple math rules:
mathExplanation.rule1: Each home can be either empty or have a friend living in it
mathExplanation.rule2: We count how many friends live in the 8 homes around each home
mathExplanation.rule3: Based on that number, we decide if a friend stays, leaves, or a new friend moves in
mathExplanation.automaton: This is called a cellular automaton - a fancy way of saying "grid cells that follow rules to change over time"!
mathExplanation.patterns: Even though the rules are super simple, they can create amazing patterns that look like they're alive! Scientists use similar math to study:

oscillator.title: Oscillator Patterns
oscillator.description: These patterns repeat over and over!

spaceship.title: Spaceship Patterns
spaceship.description: These patterns move across the grid!

gliderGun.title: Glider Gun Patterns
gliderGun.description: These amazing patterns create new patterns forever!
